meanings.definition: Add color to (a black and white photograph)
meanings.sent1: She was colourising the old photograph to make it look more vibrant.
meanings.sent2: The artist spent hours colourising the black and white image to bring it to life.
meanings.sent3: After colourising the picture, it looked like a whole new scene!
meanings.sent4: Her talent for colourising photos transformed them into works of art.
meanings.sent5: The process of colourising the photograph was tedious but rewarding.

meanings.sent1: The painter was colourising the canvas with bright hues.
meanings.sent2: The flowers in the garden were colourising the landscape beautifully.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally spilled paint while colourising the wall, creating a unique pattern.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter colourised the room with joy and warmth.
meanings.sent5: The sunset was colourising the sky in shades of pink and orange.
